poem:
Moments Before

Ariana in mid-spin,  
her gown a swirl of sequins,  
as the virus tiptoes  
in the shadows backstage,  
silent as a stagehand.  
  
She smiles, unaware  
of the pause prescribed,  
her voice destined  
for echoes beyond this frame,  
the arc of her song  
interrupted, only to resume  
in quieter rooms.
